title: Typeface recommendation
content:
Hi,

I was wondering if fellow Typophiles could recommend a typeface that would go with the image below and keywords like: culture & cross-cultural, diversity, education, social, playful, universal. I'd like it to be rather bold, mainly for display purposes - titles, headings and shorter texts but a body text weight for longer descriptions would be nice too.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717081329im_/http:/typophile.com/files/forum-logo_6512.jpg)

Thank you.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
Aleksander  
 [www.culturepicture.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717081329/http:/www.culturepicture.com/ "www.culturepicture.com")
author: aleksander

comments.content:
Preissig has interesting shapes. I also like the fun of [FF Prater](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717081329/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_prater_ot) but ideally it would be something in between. Thanks.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
 [AL](http://web.archive.org/web/20120717081329/http:/www.lenart.pl/)

It has a cut feel to it  
I think Koch's Neuland face  
would be good for very  
bold headlines
